member.name: T:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.ApplyAction
member.summary: Specifies the options for processing a row when the row cannot be applied during synchronization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.ApplyAction.Continue
member.summary: Continue processing, and add the row to the list of conflicts that are defined in the object. This is the default behavior.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.ApplyAction.RetryApplyingRow
member.summary: Try to apply the row one more time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.ApplyAction.RetryNextSync
member.summary: Store the row as an exception, and try to apply the row during the next synchronization session. Only valid for peer to peer synchronization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.ApplyAction.RetryWithForceWrite
member.summary: Force the row to be applied by using logic that is included in synchronization adapter commands.

member.summary: Defines the way in which changes are tracked in the peer database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.ChangeTrackingModel.Coupled
member.summary: Tracking columns are in the base table, and a tombstone table is used to track deletes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.ChangeTrackingModel.Decoupled
member.summary: All tracking columns are in a separate table.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.ConflictType
member.summary: Defines the types of conflicts that can occur during synchronization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.ConflictType.ClientDeleteServerUpdate
member.summary: The client deleted a row that the server updated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.ConflictType.ClientInsertServerInsert
member.summary: The client and server both inserted a row that has the same primary key value. This caused a primary key violation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.ConflictType.ClientUpdateServerDelete
member.summary: The server deleted a row that the client updated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.ConflictType.ClientUpdateServerUpdate
member.summary: The client and the server updated the same row.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.ConflictType.ErrorsOccurred
member.summary: The client or server store (typically a database) threw an exception while applying a change.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.ConflictType.Unknown
member.summary: The client synchronization provider can classify all conflicts that it encounters, but the server synchronization provider cannot. Therefore, some conflicts are classified as .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncDirection
member.summary: Defines the direction that data changes flow, from the perspective of the client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncDirection.Bidirectional
member.summary: During the first synchronization, the client typically downloads schema and an initial data set from the server. On subsequent synchronizations, the client uploads changes to the server and then downloads changes from the server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncDirection.DownloadOnly
member.summary: During the first synchronization, the client typically downloads schema and an initial data set from the server. On subsequent synchronizations, the client downloads changes from the server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncDirection.Snapshot
member.summary: The client downloads a set of data from the server. The data is completely refreshed during each synchronization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncDirection.UploadOnly
member.summary: During the first synchronization, the client typically downloads schema from the server. On subsequent synchronizations, the client uploads changes to the server.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber
member.summary: Defines a list of errors that can occur during synchronization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.AddingTableMetadataFailed
member.summary: The local database could not add metadata columns to a table that is included in synchronization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.InvalidArguments
member.summary: One of the arguments specified is not valid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.InvalidSchemaDataSet
member.summary: The table schema is not valid for one of the tables that should be created in the local database. If you specify a schema by using , make sure that the data set contains a valid schema for all tables that should be synchronized.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.InvalidValue
member.summary: The value specified for one of the arguments is not valid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.MetadataDoesNotExist
member.summary: One of the anchor values is missing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.MissingSelectCommand
member.summary: One of the SELECT commands that are used to retrieve data changes has not been defined.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.MissingSessionVariable
member.summary: A required session variable is missing for one of the SELECT commands that are used to retrieve data changes. For a list of session variables, see .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.MissingTableSchema
member.summary: The table schema is not defined for one of the tables that should be created in the local database. If you specify a schema by using , make sure that the data set contains a valid schema for all tables that should be synchronized.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.ParsingQueryFailed
member.summary: The remote data store could not parse one of the SELECT commands that are used to retrieve data changes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.PrimaryKeyNotFound
member.summary: A table does not have a primary key. A primary key is required to identify rows during synchronization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.StoreException
member.summary: An exception was thrown by the remote data store.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.SyncInProgress
member.summary: A synchronization session is in progress and was called. Only one session can be in progress at a time for the local database. Only one session can be in progress at a time for a specified table in the remote database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.TableAlreadyExists
member.summary: The table already exists in the database, and you specified a value of for .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.TableDoesNotExist
member.summary: The table does not exist in the database, and you specified a value of for .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.TableIsNotTracked
member.summary: Cannot retrieve data changes from a table because the change tracking metadata does not exist for that table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.SyncErrorNumber.Unknown
member.summary: An unknown error occurred during synchronization.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.TableCreationOption
member.summary: Defines the options that are available for creating a table in the client database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.TableCreationOption.CreateNewTableOrFail
member.summary: Create the table in the client database. If an existing table has the same name, throw an exception.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.TableCreationOption.DropExistingOrCreateNewTable
member.summary: Create the table in the client database. If an existing table has the same name, drop the existing table first.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.TableCreationOption.TruncateExistingOrCreateNewTable
member.summary: Create the table in the client database if the table does not exist. If an existing table has the same name, delete all rows from this table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.TableCreationOption.UploadExistingOrCreateNewTable
member.summary: Create the table in the client database if the table does not exist. If an existing table has the same name, upload all rows from this table on the first synchronization. This option is only valid with a of or .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Synchronization.Data.TableCreationOption.UseExistingTableOrFail
member.summary: Use an existing table in the client database that has the same name. If the table does not exist, throw an exception.
